articles.author: Variety
articles.title: Trump Whisperers Steven Paul and Scott Karol on a Foreign Film Tariff
articles.description: Steven Paul and Scott Karol spoke to Variety about meeting with President Trump at Mar-a-Lago to pitch their plan to save Hollywood.
articles.content:
Steven Paul has been to Mar-a-Lago many times over the years. The producer and longtime manager to Jon Voight was there again last weekend, along with producer Scott Karol, to pitch President Trump on their plan to save Hollywood.
“I always enjoy bei... [10640 chars]

articles.author: The Associated Press
articles.title: US to accept white South African refugees while other programs remain paused
articles.description: The Trump administration will welcome more than two dozen white South Africans to the United States as refugees next week.
articles.content: WASHINGTON (AP) — The Trump administration will welcome more than two dozen white South Africans to the United States as refugees next week, an unusual move because it has suspended most refugee resettlement operations, officials and documents said F... [6653 chars]

articles.author: CP24 Toronto
articles.title: White House looking at suspending habeas corpus
articles.description: White House deputy chief of staff Stephen Miller told reporters Friday that the Trump administration is “actively looking at” suspending habeas corpus — a legal procedure that allows people to challenge a government’s decision to detain them.
articles.content:
White House deputy chief of staff for policy Stephen Miller speaks to the media outside the White House in Washington, D.C., on May 9. (Kent Nishimura/Reuters via CNN Newsource)

articles.author: UPI News
articles.title: White House considering suspending habeas corpus for deportations, Trump adviser Steven Miller says
articles.description: The Trump administration is "actively looking at" suspending the writ of habeas corpus, which is the right to challenge the legality of a person's detention by the government, senior adviser Stephen Miller said.
articles.content:
1 of 3 | White House senior adviser Stephen Miller told reporters the writ of habeas corpus can be suspended in a time of invasion. Photo by Yuri Gripas/UPI | License Photo

articles.author: BreakingNews.ie
articles.title: Judge halts Trump’s downsizing of federal agencies
articles.description: The temporary restraining order directs numerous federal agencies to halt acting on the president’s workforce executive order.
articles.content:
The Republican administration must halt much of its dramatic downsizing of the federal workforce, a California judge has ordered.
Judge Susan Illston in San Francisco issued the emergency order in a lawsuit filed by unions and cities last week, one o... [3686 chars]

articles.title: Federal Reserve official sees signs of slowing economy but not ready to cut rates

articles.author: Cable News Network
articles.title: FedEx board member David Steiner to be next US postmaster general
articles.description: The US Postal Service Board of Governors announced Friday that David Steiner, a board member at FedEx, will be the next postmaster general – a move that comes amid concerns the Trump administration will push for privatization of the mail delivery service, an independent government agency.
articles.content:

articles.author: Sky News
articles.title: Why many assume interest rates will fall further - but no one really has a clue
articles.description: The UK central bank thinks Trump tariffs will be much less damaging than many assumed, with the impact not enough to push the UK into recession. But today's forecasts underline it's becoming fiendishly difficult to predict the future.
articles.content:
Let's deal, first of all, with the question many of you will have: after today's reduction to 4.25% will there be more interest rate cuts to come?
Today, the Bank of England did nothing to sway you - or the financial markets that bet on such things -... [2622 chars]

articles.author: The Intercept
articles.title: “I Don’t Know.” Trump’s Go-To Response to All Sorts of Questions
articles.description: Three times in the last week, Trump expressed ignorance when responding to questions about his signature policies.
articles.content:
President Donald Trump keeps saying he doesn’t know what his own administration is up to.
Three times in the last week, Trump responded to questions about his signature policies by expressing ignorance.

articles.author: CBS News
articles.title: Trump administration "actively looking" at suspending habeas corpus to deport migrants, Stephen Miller says
articles.description: Habeas corpus entails the constitutional right to appear before a court to challenge detention.
articles.content:
The Trump administration is "actively looking at" the possibility of suspending the writ of habeas corpus to handle people the administration says aren't in the country legally, White House deputy chief of staff Stephen Miller said Friday.
